ygData.messageBody:
Good advice from the others so far. Here is how I sometimes deal with em.

First ... in character or not, kill stealing is kill stealing. I hate it and most
other players do too. I happened to be in the snake pit in BB one night and there
were four people there. Three of us had been rotating kills for about 30 minutes
or so. The fourth one came in ... a female human paladin. She proceeded to take
all snakes she could, including jumping in on our fights and looting the corpses.
It was annoying to say the least. When questioned about it she replied, "Sorry
... gotta make level." Okay, excuse me for being rude here but what the hell?
Like the rest of us DON'T have to make level?

The three originals ended up grouping and taking every single kill and loot for
about 45 minutes until she left. It was fun and we laughed at her the whole time
during group chat. Not to mention we made some good exp even though grouped, and
some moderate loot also.

Moral of this story: When it's only one person annoying you ... form an anti-jerk
group with the sole purpose of driving them away. It works because your group
will always do more damage, thus getting the exp, AND the loot.

Good hunting,
Faderic (and Rosmorte)


Morix@... wrote:

> But onto other warrior-related topics: I have a story that led to a
> particularly interesting problem. Currently I am an 8th lvl warrior on
> Cazic-Thule who adventures around the Freeport environs: Desert of Ro,
> Commonlands, et al. One day in the desert this nasty little dark elf
> shadowknight has hanging around and this guy is a known kill-stealer and a
> real jerk (anyone who frequents the desert *might* know who I'm t/*alking
> about). He was hanging around our party making rude gestures at us and
> calling us really nasty names. Then he seemed to go away. A little while
> later I spotted him fighting a giant spider so I figured I'd teach him a
> little lesson. I ran over and attacked it myself, and he starts telling me
> to back off. Of course it didn't matter much because he easily defeated it
> quickly thereafter. "Oh well," I thought, "His comeuppance shall be had
> another day." I then ran over to attack an orc. Well this little pest
> followed me over and killed off the orc I was fighting, then told me that was
> my punishment for trying to steal his kill. This got me really angry. I
> wanted to challenge him to a duel but he was one level higher than I and had
> some really good armor to boot so I figured I would lose. I took a
> screenshot of him using foul language and sent a petition, but I was told by
> a GM to just work it out myself. Some verbal tennis was had between my party
> and this dark elf, but other than shooting off a few tart zingers we were
> pretty much up a creek with this guy.
>
> What is one to do in a situation like this? Has anyone else ever come across
> this kind of thing? What did you do about it?
>
